POS 5 11,6

SPR r
00000000
00000000
00000000
11111111
00000000
00000000
00010000
00010000
POS 6 8,6

DLG a
Where are they?

DLG b
I better be getting something for doing this, it's way too late to be driving out to the middle of nowhere.

DLG c
I wish I'd bought a tape, the reception here is awful.

DLG d
...nothing, not even Radio 4.

DLG e
God it's so dark out here too.

DLG f
"... 076... 065... 085... 078... 067... 072..."

DLG g
...hang on, what was that?

DLG h
"..."                      ...it's gone, well that was creepy.

DLG i
What are they even doing out here so late that I have to be the taxi? 

DLG j
What the fuck?

DLG k
That's it, I don't care what happens to them, I don't want to be out here any more I...

DLG l
...want to...

DLG m
It's cold tonight, the proper kind, where you can see your breath on the air.

DLG n
I don't mind the quiet really, nice to be away from all the news chatter.

DLG o
Sometimes I think I just want it to end, to come to a head and just be over...daft thought.

DLG p
I'd feel sorry for the birds though, if anything happened, they don't deserve to be caught up in our mess.

DLG q
Maybe I should take up pottery, it's the safest kind of art I heard. I'll make some tiles, or pins.

DLG r
Doesn't seem quite as cold out now.

END 0
...go home...
